name: FATMAP
slogan: Wherever your inspiration takes you, you'll be ready for any adventure
description:
Why FATMAP

- We are pioneers - in the outdoors as well as in tech and mapping. We aim to build the world's best outdoor map. We offer to work with the latest tools on latest mapping technology.
- We love our product and use it as often as possible. We want to make everyday count, spend our time wisely and get lots of fresh air and good views besides the office.
- We strive for quality. Everyone on the team is an expert in his or her field. If you want to thrive in this environment, we are welcoming you.
- We believe we can make the outdoors a safer place through technology so that more outdoor enthusiasts can have better and safer adventures. If you believe in this cause, join us.se.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Misha Gopaul
team.bioHtml: Founded Fabric Technologies (sold to Advanced Computer Software Group 2012. Founded Workplace Fabric. Investor & Advisor at Abide Financial. Founder at FATMAP.

team.name: Jonathon Williams
team.bioHtml: Currently a freelance filmmaker, photographer and editor based in the Bavarian mountains working on projects with clients including Audi, Red Bull, GoPro, DJI

team.title: Head of Product
team.name: William Gill
team.bioHtml: Product guy who likes making stuff. Head of Product at FATMAP. Formerly product @ Rocket Internet, HERE and Nokia.

jobs.title: QA Lead/Engineer
jobs.description:
Build the leading outdoor adventure platform 
 
FATMAP is an Outdoor Adventure Platform that brings together consumers with businesses, destinations and brands. Our advanced 3D mapping technology, outdoor community and curated adventure guidebook is used by top professionals and outdoor enthusiasts to enjoy better, safer adventure. 
 
As a QA Lead/Engineer at FATMAP, you will help build the leading platform for outdoor adventure. 
 
If you’re a skier, boarder, runner or biker, and you want to work on the largest outdoor adventure platform, then you’ll be perfect for FATMAP. 
 
Check out our product at fatmap.com, or download the app from the App Store. 

Your responsibilities: 
* Lead QA team, define and follow the release procedures, communicate with other teams. 
* Create and maintain QA automated tests. 
* Manual testing of the application (some things are hard to automate;). 
* Write and manage the set of test cases covering the applications. 
* Document software bugs and errors and prepare quality reports. 

Your profile: 
* You have experience as a QA engineer. 
* You feel comfortable in leading a team of 3 QA engineers.  
* You have great analytical and lateral thinking skills, which you can use to 
* Identify possible app side effects. 
* You have an eye for detail and a good sense of what makes a good user experience.  
* You are a self-starter and you are able to learn independently. 
* Knowledge of automated testing will be a plus. 
* You have good spoken and written English skills.  
* You are able to work on-site in our office in Vilnius, Lithuania. 

What we offer: 
Responsibility from day one, and an opportunity to develop your skills in a challenging environment with a growing company in an exciting space.  
A great office environment in Vilnius, Lithuania. 
Flexible working hours. 
The opportunity to grow with a growing company in an exciting space. 

How to apply: 
If the above sounds like you, and you have an adventurous spirit (both in the technological and outdoors sense), you'll fit right in. Please contact us through angel-list. 

We're looking forward to hear from you!

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Engineer - React Native (in Berlin or Vilnius)
jobs.description:
Build the future of outdoor adventure with us!

Your challenge

* You'll be continuing the work we’ve put in over the last 18 months building the FATMAP mobile app, and helping us become the tool of choice for everyone's outdoor adventures. We’re looking for a mobile app developer who is very strong on React Native and has developed native apps on either iOS or Android (ideally both).
* You will take ownership of our mobile platform, building rich media experiences and an impeccable user experience based on React Native and our in-house 3D mapping SDK. You’ll help us to solve interesting problems (such as how to reliably report location when offline halfway up a mountain) that don’t crop up in your average todo list app.
* We work flexible hours and we all do some remote work, but we believe that the best results come from working side-by-side.

Your responsibilities

* Take ownership of our mobile platform and team, helping us to grow both to become the go-to companion for adventures across the globe.
* Strong focus on performance, stability and reliability, even (especially) when offline.
* Work with the design team to build flawless user experiences at 60fps.
* As part of our Product team, work closely with our Rendering and Platform teams to deliver a unified, premium experience across all platforms.
* Help us stabilise the existing application by continuing and expanding our practices of testing, type-safe code, and QA (manual and automated).
* Contribute to the evolution of our engineering practices, mentor our junior developers and get involved with our frequent discussions on code quality, best practices, and workflows.

Your profile

* Strong experience working with React Native on production apps, with knowledge of existing standards and best practices.
* Have at least 7 years experience with mobile app development.
* Strong experience with Javascript (ES6) + Flow, or Typescript.
* Knowledge in any or all of any or all of: Swift, Objective-C, Java, Kotlin is a big plus.
* Experience with Redux and GraphQL a big plus.
* Strong familiarity with mobile ecosystems, from integrating services such as subscription payments and location all the way through to deployment workflows for production apps in the App/Play Store.
* Enjoy writing tests and type-safe code (yes, even in Javascript!).
* Are focused on a phenomenal user experience, especially when it comes to reliability and performance.
* Have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to describe technical architecture to non-techies.
* Any experience with navigation/location, and especially offline-only applications is a big plus!
* Excellent spoken and written English.

What we offer

* A great open space office environment in Berlin, Germany OR Vilnius, Lithuania
* Flexible working hours
* Free breakfast, coffee, fruits, etc.
* The technical tools (laptop, screens etc.) of your choice
* Unlimited reference materials (for both tech and adventure)
* Regular team/company trips to outdoor adventure destinations
* Outdoor Adventure as your core working topic - including an office/ apartment space in the mountains of Chamonix for you to receive your regular alpine inspiration dose.
* The opportunity to grow and take over responsibility with a growing company in an exciting space

Are you interested? Apply here: https://grnh.se/70b5bd672

jobs.title: Senior Platform Engineer
jobs.description:
You have:

Solid Kubernetes experience in a professional environment
●	You have experience scaling Kubernetes (including auto-scaling)
●	You have deployed a Kubernetes deployment on AWS
●	You've implemented metrics, logging and tracing
●	You know how to get under the hood to diagnose issues when things go wrong

Good knowledge of AWS (or GCE)
●	EC2 & VPCs
●	S3
●	DynamoDB
●	RDS (Postgres/Aurora)
●	Cloudfront
●	SQS
●	Route 53

Worked with some of the following technologies
●	Golang
●	Ruby/Python
●	Bash script
●	Postgres

Knowledge of fundamentals of GIS
●	You can use PostGIS to run basic queries

Your responsibilities:
●	As a fast growing company, scaling our systems as we grow will be a core part of your job.
●	Building out our metrics, logging and tracing infrastructure to give us full insight into our stack.
●	Looking after our AWS & Heroku accounts & infrastructure.
●	Managing our external services (CDNs, Databases etc)
●	Ensuring security standards throughout our infrastructure.
●	Improving the performance and reliability of our tile and data stacks.
●	Maintaining and improving our user databases.
●	Iterating on our PostGIS adventure databases.
●	Mentoring our more junior developers.
●	Building on our current engineering processes such as code reviews, pull requests etc.
●	Helping us continue to build our engineering culture.

Your profile:
●	You're an engineer that can see the bigger picture, you understand why performance and quality is important to our end users and why automated tests and documentation are important to our wider engineering team.
●	You care deeply about the quality of the work you produce.
●	You can distill complex requirements into a non-complex solution.
●	You have excellent communication skills and can explain complicated problems in an easy to understand way.
●	You are dynamic and can effortlessly transition between the various facets of the company as required.
●	You are a self-starter and comfortable taking the lead on certain aspects of your role.
●	You are comfortable mentoring other members of the engineering team.

You have:

Solid Kubernetes experience in a professional environment
● You have experience scaling Kubernetes (including auto-scaling)
● You have deployed a Kubernetes deployment on AWS
● You've implemented metrics, logging and tracing
● You know how to get under the hood to diagnose issues when things go wrong

● You can use PostGIS to run basic queries

● As a fast growing company, scaling our systems as we grow will be a core part of your job.
● Building out our metrics, logging and tracing infrastructure to give us full insight into our stack.
● Looking after our AWS & Heroku accounts & infrastructure.
● Managing our external services (CDNs, Databases etc)
● Ensuring security standards throughout our infrastructure.
● Improving the performance and reliability of our tile and data stacks.
● Maintaining and improving our user databases.
● Iterating on our PostGIS adventure databases.
● Mentoring our more junior developers.
● Building on our current engineering processes such as code reviews, pull requests etc.
● Helping us continue to build our engineering culture.

Your profile:
● You're an engineer that can see the bigger picture, you understand why performance and quality is important to our end users and why automated tests and documentation are important to our wider engineering team.
● You care deeply about the quality of the work you produce.
● You can distill complex requirements into a non-complex solution.
● You have excellent communication skills and can explain complicated problems in an easy to understand way.
● You are dynamic and can effortlessly transition between the various facets of the company as required.
● You are a self-starter and comfortable taking the lead on certain aspects of your role.
● You are comfortable mentoring other members of the engineering team.

jobs.title: Senior React Developer
jobs.description:
Your challenge

You will play a leading role in helping our Web and Mobile apps become the tool of choice for everyone's outdoor adventures. 
You will optimise our existing products as well as build new features in our React web and mobile apps, based on our own in-house 3D mapping SDK. 
You’ll help us to solve interesting problems (such as how to reliably report location when offline halfway up a mountain) that don’t crop up in your average todo list app.
We work flexible hours and we all do some remote work, but we believe that the best results come from working side-by-side.

Your responsibilities

Feature Development and Optimisation for React Web and Mobile apps.
Focus on building flawless, pixel-perfect User Interfaces at 60fps, in close collaboration with our Design team.
Strong focus on performance, stability and reliability, even (especially) when offline.
Work closely with our Rendering and Platform teams to deliver a unified, premium experience across all platforms.
Help us stabilise the existing application by continuing and expanding our practices of testing, type-safe code, and QA (manual and automated).
Contribute to the evolution of our engineering practices, mentor our junior developers and get involved with our frequent discussions on code quality, best practices, and workflows.

Your profile

You’re a great fit, if you:

Have strong experience working with React and React Native on production apps, with knowledge of existing standards and best practices.
Have at least 7 years experience with web and/or mobile app development.
Have strong experience with Javascript (ES6) + Flow, or Typescript.
Enjoy writing tests and type-safe code (yes, even in Javascript!).
Are focused on a phenomenal user experience, especially when it comes to pixel-perfect UI, reliability and performance.
Have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to describe technical architecture to non-techies.
Excellent spoken and written English.

It’s a big plus if you have:

Have experience with Redux and GraphQL.
Have familiarity with mobile ecosystems, from integrating services such as subscription payments and location all the way through to deployment workflows for production apps in the App/Play Store.
Any experience with navigation/location apps, and especially offline-only mobile applications.
